items.summary: A new study reveals an unknown species of whiplash squid burying itself upside down in the deep sea â€” a first-of-its-kind behavior for cephalopods.

items.title: Former champion Cross cruises through at Worlds
items.summary: Former champion Rob Cross is safely through to the second round of the PDC World Championship after a comfortable 3-0 win over Norway's Cor Dekker.

items.title: F1 stakeholders sign new Concorde Agreement
items.summary: Formula 1 has finalised a new Concorde Agreement, the legal contract that defines the relationship between the key stakeholders in the sport.

items.title: 'A Mourinho move' - Prior defends McCullum after criticism
items.summary: Former England wicketkeeper Matt Prior says Brendon McCullum's "over-prepared" comment was a "Mourinho move", taking the spotlight off England's players following their defeat to Australia in the second Ashes Test.

items.title: The Best Permanent Outdoor Lights (2025): Govee, Eufy, Lepro
items.summary: DIY permanent eave lights that attach to the exterior of your home are becoming more popular. But are they worth the effort (and cost)?

items.title: Edwards to face PFL champion Van Steenis in March
items.summary: Britain's Fabian Edwards will face Costello van Steenis for the PFL middleweight title in Madrid on 20 March.

items.title: Bucs coach launches foul-mouthed rant after Falcons upset
items.summary: Tampa Bay Buccaneers head coach Todd Bowles launches an expletive-laden rant after his team relinquishes a late lead to lose at home to the Atlanta Falcons.

items.title: Best Merino Wool T-Shirts (2025), Tried On and Tested
items.summary: These merino wool T-shirts are the last shirt youâ€™ll ever wear. Iâ€™m wearing one right now.

items.title: New 'DNA cassette tape' can store up to 1.5 million times more data than a smartphone â€” and the data can last 20,000 years if frozen
items.summary: Scientists have discovered that over half a mile of DNA could hold over 360,000 terabytes of data.

items.title: 'It's more than a job' - Bowles furious at Buccaneers after defeat
items.summary: Tampa Bay Buccaneers head coach Todd Bowles lashes out at his players in a explosive rant after a fifth loss in six games against the Atlanta Falcons, which drops them to second in the NFC South division and puts their play-off chances at risk.

items.title: Baseus Inspire XH1 Headphones Review: Affordable Excellence
items.summary: Watch out high-end models, these noise-canceling headphones are an amazing value.

items.title: China's Great Green Wall: The giant artificial forest designed to slow the expansion of 2 deserts
items.summary: Since 1978, China has planted more than 66 billion trees along its 2,800-mile-long northern border, and it wants to plant 34 billion more over the next 25 years to complete its "Great Green Wall."

items.title: Injured Wales centre Llewellyn could miss Six Nations
items.summary: Gloucester are set to be without centre pairing Max Llewellyn and Will Joseph for a "decent" period after they picked up injuries against Castres in the Champions Cup.

items.title: BBC to show Macclesfield and Spurs FA Cup ties
items.summary: Non-league Macclesfield's FA Cup third round tie with holders Crystal Palace will be televised live on BBC One on Saturday, 10 January (12:15 GMT kick-off).

items.title: Six players to watch at Afcon 2025
items.summary: BBC Sport Africa picks out six players to keep an eye on at the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations in Morocco from 21 December to 18 January.

items.title: Vonn, 41, becomes oldest downhill World Cup winner

items.title: 'It felt like God's hand on my brain' - the day England were humbled by teenager
items.summary: BBC Sport's From The Ashes series concludes with the inside story of Ashton Agar's record-breaking introduction to Test cricket as a 19-year-old batting at number 11.

items.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
items.summary: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.
